item.title: Solideon wants to decentralize rocket manufacturing through 3D printing
item.description:
Nearly five years after COVID-19 ground the world to a halt, the global supply chain still hasn’t fully recovered. Specialty industries like space travel were particularly hard hit, given the impossibility of heading down to the corner to pick up spare rocket parts. Industries began taking a long, hard look at 3D printing as a […]

item.title: CrowdStrike, Delta Sue Each Other Over Flight Disruptions Due To July Crash
item.description: Cybersecurity firm CrowdStrike said on Monday it sued Delta Air Lines in US District Court in Georgia after a faulty software update prompted a global outage in July.

item.title: Indonesia blocks Apple iPhone 16 sales over lack of investment
item.description:
Marketing and sale of model prohibited after tech giant fails to meet rule 40% of phones be made from local parts

Indonesia has prohibited the marketing and sale of the iPhone 16 model over Apple’s failure to meet local investment regulations, according to its industry ministry.

South-east Asia’s biggest economy has a young, tech-savvy population with more than 100 million people under the age of 30, but Apple still does not have an official store in the country, forcing those who want its products to buy from resale platforms.

Continue reading...

item.title: Double your power with Office 2021 + Windows 11 Pro for life on sale for just £40.84
item.description: Pick up both Microsoft Office Professional 2021 and Windows 11 Pro for life for just £40.84 (reg. £337.70) through 27 October.
